DataElement.preferredName: Excisional Biopsy And/Or Excision Surgical Procedure Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day, and year the excisional biopsy / surgical procedure was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Excisional Biopsy And/Or Excision Surgical Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Excisional Biopsy And/Or Excision Surgical Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ek-SI-zhun-al BY-op-see) A surgical procedure in which an entire lump or suspicious area is removed for diagnosis. The tissue is then examined under a microscope.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:Removal or excision by surgical measures.:Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.
